meanings.definition: Wistarias: a type of flowering plant with long clusters of fragrant purple or white flowers.
meanings.sent1: The garden was filled with beautiful wistarias blooming in the spring.
meanings.sent2: I planted some wistarias along the fence to add color to the yard.
meanings.sent3: The mischievous squirrel tried to hide nuts among the wistarias but got caught in the vines.
meanings.sent4: Her laughter cascaded through the room like a waterfall of wistarias in full bloom.
meanings.sent5: The sweet scent of wistarias lingered in the air, enchanting all who passed by.

meanings.definition: Wistarias: the plural form of wistaria, a type of flowering plant.
meanings.sent1: In the botanical garden, wistarias of all colors and sizes could be seen.
meanings.sent2: The wistarias in her backyard attracted butterflies and bees with their nectar.
meanings.sent3: The children played hide-and-seek among the wistarias, their laughter echoing in the garden.
meanings.sent4: The wistarias swayed gently in the breeze, creating a mesmerizing dance of colors.
meanings.sent5: As the sun set, the wistarias seemed to glow with a magical light, painting the garden in hues of purple and white.

meanings.definition: Wistarias: belonging to or characteristic of the wistaria plant.
meanings.sent1: The wistarias vines climbed up the trellis, creating a natural canopy of flowers.
meanings.sent2: Her dress was adorned with delicate wistarias embroidery, adding a touch of elegance.
meanings.sent3: The mischievous cat got tangled in the wistarias, looking both confused and adorable.
meanings.sent4: His voice had a soothing quality, like the scent of wistarias on a warm summer day.
meanings.sent5: The old house had a quaint charm, with wistarias framing the windows like living curtains.
